page.title: 03CHINA CLAY: USES
page.content:
{China Clay}was first{discovered}in the St.Austell area in{1748.}20% of the world's production comes from English China Clays; 87% of which is exported all over the world.
Of the company's production, 80% is used in{paper making,}china clay being the most important material in the process after wood pulp. It has two uses: first, as a{filler,}to fill the small spaces between wood fibres, reducing costs and increasing the quality of the paper; second, as a {coating,}increasing the brightness and smoothness of the paper, ensuring top quality reproduction of print.
China Clay is used in{ceramics,}first by Wedgewood to retain shape during firing. It is also a constituent of {paints, polymers,}and{medicines.
